conclusion: Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time; slope of tangent on v-t graph gives acceleration.
Positive slope indicates positive acceleration; negative slope indicates negative acceleration.
Car A's v-t graph consists of two identical arcs.
From t = 0 to t = 2 seconds, velocity increases from 0 m/s to 2 m/s.
From t = 2 to t = 4 seconds, velocity decreases from 2 m/s back to 0 m/s.
From t = 0 to t = 2 seconds, slope is positive, indicating positive acceleration.
From t = 2 to t = 4 seconds, slope is negative, indicating negative acceleration.
At t = 2 seconds, slope changes from positive to negative, indicating a change in direction of acceleration.
Yes, the direction of Car A's acceleration changed within the time interval of 0 to 4 seconds.
